pages.text: Foreyia maxkuhni was a bizarre coelacanth that lived during the Middle Triassic in what is now Switzerland. It is named after coelacanth researcher Peter L. Forey, and Max Kuhn who prepared many fossils from the region of Switzerland where this Foreyia was discovered (including fossils of the animal itself). Despite being in the same family as the modern coelacanth (Latimeriidae), Foreyia's anatomy was rather unusual by comparison: Its head was proportionately enormous, its maxilla (upper jaw) was beak-like, and it had an underbite.
